adPlacements.name: Header Leaderboard
adPlacements.description: Positioned prominently at the top of the page, this placement captures immediate attention.
pros: Works well on desktop and tablet
First ad users see when page loads
cons: Can appear intrusive if not well-designed
May push content below the fold
adPlacements.implementation: Place within header section using AdSense auto ads or manual placement

adPlacements.name: In-Content Rectangle
adPlacements.description: Strategically placed within content, these ads blend naturally with the reading experience.
pros: High engagement due to content integration
cons: May disrupt reading experience if overused
adPlacements.implementation: Insert after 2-3 paragraphs using shortcode or programmatic insertion

adPlacements.name: End-of-Article Banner
adPlacements.description: Placed at the end of articles to capture engaged readers who finished the content.
cons: May compete with social sharing buttons
adPlacements.implementation: Automatic insertion after content or manual placement in article templates

adPlacements.name: Sidebar Skyscraper
adPlacements.description: Vertical ads in the sidebar that remain visible while scrolling through content.
adPlacements.implementation: Fixed sidebar placement with optional sticky positioning

adPlacements.name: Mobile Banner
adPlacements.position: Top or bottom of mobile screen
adPlacements.description: Mobile-optimized banners designed specifically for smartphone users.
cons: Smaller ad size means lower CPM
May obstruct content on small screens
adPlacements.implementation: Responsive ad units with mobile-specific sizing and positioning

adPlacements.name: In-Feed Native Ads
adPlacements.description: Native ads that blend seamlessly with content feeds and article lists.
adPlacements.implementation: Native ad networks or custom feed integration with proper disclosure

tips: Test different ad positions to find optimal performance
Maintain 1-2 ads above the fold maximum
Use heat map analysis to identify high-engagement areas
Consider user behavior patterns when placing ads
Avoid ads that cover content on mobile
Use responsive ad units for cross-device compatibility
Test loading speeds with ads on mobile networks
Ensure ads don't negatively impact Core Web Vitals
Provide clear value in content to justify ad presence
Use ad density that doesn't overwhelm content
Implement lazy loading for below-fold ads
Track CTR, viewability, and revenue by placement
Monitor page load speeds with ads
Analyze user engagement metrics alongside ad performance
